summary: This is an email from August 12, 2019, providing staffing statistics for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, including vacancy rates and recruitment efforts. It is significant as it details the staffing situation at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held at the time of his death.

events.title: Career Fair at 290 Broadway
events.description: MCC New York held a career fair at 290 Broadway, which was attended by 174 potential applicants.

events.title: Scheduled Officer Start Date
events.description: Two additional correctional officers are scheduled to start work.

events.title: Approval of Staffing Incentives
events.description: Since this date, MCC New York has been approved for a 10% relocation incentive and a 10% recruitment incentive.

keyFacts: As of August 12, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York had an overall staffing level of 84.86% and a correctional services staffing level of 83.70%.
There were 19 vacant officer positions and, critically, 0 out of 24 P01A Correctional Officer positions were filled.
The facility had been approved for 10% relocation and recruitment incentives since April 12, 2019, and had conducted advertising and a career fair to address staffing shortages.
